mobs.LongDesc: A hill giant lumbers around here, looking for something to smash.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Hill giants are ugly humanoids, about 10 1/2 feet tall and very strong. They
aren't very smart, but what they lack in intelligence they more than make up
for in brutality and strength. This one isn't happy to see you.

mobs.LongDesc: A female hill giant roams around here, looking for humans to kill and eat.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Female hill giants are no prettier than their male counterparts, being only
slightly shorter and with the same low brow and brutish jawline. While they
are not quite as strong as their menfolk, they are certainly stronger than 
you are...you'd best hope this one hasn't seen you!

mobs.LongDesc: A dire wolf poises itself to leap at your throat!
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This wolf looks lean and hungry...it's probably living off whatever carrion
it's hill giant masters don't claim for themselves. It slavers eagerly as it
contemplates your succulent flesh...

mobs.LongDesc: A hill giant raider advances on you with murder in his eyes!
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This hill giant is even taller and uglier than the norm, which is really
saying something. His arms look powerful enough to crush granite, and the
stench rising from his unwashed body is nearly palpable. He looks as if he
could cheerfully tear off all your limbs and eat them while you watch.

mobs.LongDesc: Chodak Guthru, King of the Hill Giants, contemplates your imminent demise.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Chodak Guthru is an awesome sight. Nearly twelve feet tall, his brutish 
features show great cunning, as well as numerous battle scars. His mighty
arms look strong enough to crack granite, or at the very least, every bone
in your body. His expression says that unless you are a very fast runner,
your bones will be decorating his hall tonight...

mobs.LongDesc: A tall and lanky stone giant ignores your presence.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Stone giants are lankier than their brethren of the hills, though taller.
This one stands nearly twelve feet high, with a complexion like old granite
and eyes like tarnished steel. He appears not to notice your presence in his
home, and it doesn't look like it would concern him if he did. Bothering him
or molesting his peers would probably not be a good idea, however.

mobs.LongDesc: A stone giantess calmly goes about her business here.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This stone giantess has a rather plain, homely look about her, but not nearly
as fearsome as the hill giantesses. Perhaps it is the lack of a bloodthirsty
snarl that does it. This giantess is perfectly content to leave you be, as
long as you are content to do the same. Otherwise, she might simply have to
squeeze you to a bloody pulp, and we don't want that, now, do we?

mobs.LongDesc: A stone giant rock-crusher is here, searching for attractive gemstones.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Stone giants have a primitive's love of pretty stones, hence their profession
of rock-crusher. These giants basically tear promising ore from the caves
with their bare hands and squeeze it into shiny gems. This one is intent on
his task, and does not appear to notice you. You shudder as you contemplate
what those hands might do to your soft and yielding flesh!

mobs.LongDesc: Aandaan Kechke, Chief of the Stone Giants, examines the latest ore sample.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Aandaan Kechke is rather unimpressive for a chief of the stone giants, but
he is widely known for his discerning eye in ore quality. Even the dwarves
have a grudging respect for his skills. However, his task demands a lot of
concentration, so it would probably be wise to leave before you disturb him.

mobs.LongDesc: A huge cave bear cocks its head at you quizzically.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Stone giants are known to be fond of cave bears, and frequently keep them
around as pets. This is a huge example of the type, and looks very well fed.
It doesn't seem aggressive, but you probably don't want to mess with it.

mobs.LongDesc: A frost giant ambles around here, singing guttural songs of bloodshed.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This frost giant towers over you, almost 15 feet tall. His skin is ivory in
color, with a bit of red from the biting wind whistling around you. His hair
is a vibrant yellow color, and his bushy beard is the same. His eyes are as
blue as the northern ice, and narrowed in anger as he detects your presence.
It's probably about time you left, don't you think?

mobs.LongDesc: A frost giantess wanders the area, looking for humans to kill for supper.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This is one big lady! She is at least twice the height of the tallest of
humans, and the yellow braids hanging from her head are as thick as hawsers
used to moor ships to the docks. She might be considered attractive if she
was a bit cleaner, and closer to your size, and didn't consider you a source
of food. Probably best just to stay away.

mobs.LongDesc: A frost giant berserker screams a battle cry and attacks you!
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This frost giant looks much like the others, except his body is crisscrossed
with scars of various size and severity. It looks as if he has seen many a
battle, and the mad fury in his eyes tells you that he is about to see one
more, and that he is fairly sure of who will win...

mobs.LongDesc: A winter wolf drifts silently out of the snow and pounces on you!
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This wolf is pure white except for its mouth and eyes, both of which are
bright red. You notice smoke rising from its mouth, then realize that it is
not smoke at all, but a killing frost! That frost could chill a man to his
bones, you think, as you prepare to be deep-frozen.

mobs.LongDesc: Jakan Djanneskald, Thegn of the Frost Giants, howls a battle cry and attacks!
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Jakan Djanneskald, the mighty Thegn of the Frost Giants, was once a berserker
who took one too many blows to the head from the fire giants. As a result,
he has discovered that he has a brain, and though he is still unskilled in
its use, he is still VERY capable of tearing you to pieces. Wait just a
moment, and he will demonstrate...

mobs.LongDesc: A fire giantess frowns pitilessly at you, puny human invader.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Fire giantesses are similar to human nobles in that they are haughty and
arrogant, not to be bothered by a puny human such as yourself. This one is
sort of attractive in a dusky way, but the stare of disgust she gives you as
you look her over quells any urges you might be feeling. She's still a very
big girl, so it would not be wise to anger her.

mobs.LongDesc: A fire giant bares his orange-red teeth at you in a terrifying grimace.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Though not quite as tall as their cold-weather kinsmen atop the mountain,
fire giants are a bit more powerful, and quite a bit more intelligent. This
one has coal-black skin and bristly hair of fiery orange. His eyes glow a
malevolent red as he looks you over and decides to dispose of you quickly.

mobs.LongDesc: A fire giant warrior grits his teeth in rage as you approach! RUN FOR IT!
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Fire giant warriors are very disciplined, at least compared to other giants.
They are usually well-armed and armored, and while their tactics may be a
bit inferior to those of the human and demi-human races, their huge size and
strength compensate for this rather well. You might as well lie down...dead
people aren't supposed to be walking around.

mobs.LongDesc: A grim and evil hell hound snarls and poises itself to spring...
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Hell hounds look much like large black rottweilers, as large as a man, with
sooty black fur and baleful red eyes. They are boon companions of fire giants,
who often use them for hunting (humans). Their fangs are strong and sharp,
and they have the ability to breathe fire as well. Trouble!

mobs.LongDesc: Sholom ab Akbar, Lord of the Fire Giants, roars in fury as you enter!
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Sholom ab Akbar is the tallest of the fire giants, standing nearly 13 feet
high. His coal-black skin bears the marks of many battles, and his cruel red
eyes have seen much bloodshed. Your presence here disturbs him greatly, and
he is about to do a little disturbing of his own...

mobs.LongDesc: Buel Endros Cordruin, King of the Storm Giants, is being held prisoner here.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This majestic storm giant would tower over you if he were standing, but a
heavy set of black iron chains hold him to the ground. His eyes are proud
and furious at this violation of his dignity, but he is unable to free
himself in the presence of all of these fire giants. He catches your eye
with a desperate glance, hoping you will free him from his torment.
